avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: New snow amounts are not expected to be deep or extensive. The snowpack will remain generally well bonded and stable in most locations. Greatest snow accumulations will exist on North to Easterly aspects mainly above 800 metres. Some areas at higher elevations are expected to be hard and icy, possibly covered by a thin layer of new snow.  The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: GC 16/3 limited new snow amounts forecast. Old snowpack firm, icy and stable exists mainly on N to E aspects above 850m. Av Haz Low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Overnight, the freezing level will be around 800 metres, it will slowly rise to be above the summits by the end of the day. Some very light, intermittent snow showers can be expected overnight and again late afternoon falling mostly above 1000 metres. Moderate Northerly winds will back and ease before strengthening during the day to become fresh to strong South-Easterly.
Observed Weather Influences: Overnight, the freezing level fell to around 800 metres and some precipitation gave a light cover of new snow mainly above 850 metres. A damp start early this morning then it was predominately dry with moderate to fresh North-Easterly winds, brighter conditions arrived in the afternoon.
ObservedSnowStability: New snow amounts above 850 metres are not significant. The snowpack remains generally well bonded and stable in most locations. Greatest snow accumulations are on North to Easterly aspects mainly above 850 metres there is also a light cover of snow on other aspects. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: The majority of the snowpack will be firm and generally well bonded. Greatest amounts will be found around coire rims and gully tops, mostly on West through North to East aspects above 900 metres. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: SC 16.3.24 Firm and well bonded in most locations. Greatest amounts around corrie rims W,N to E above 900m. Avalanche hazard Low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: A bright and dry day is expected. Overnight freezing level will be down to 500 metres, lifting to around 800 metres during the day. Winds will be very light around dawn but will become strong from the South-South-East later.
Observed Weather Influences: Overnight rain turned to snow above 600 metres as the freezing level lowered. Winds were mostly North-East but becoming strong North-North-East by midday.
ObservedSnowStability: There is a uniform covering of soft, wet snow above 600 metres. Drifting of new snow was limited with new accumulations only achieving depth on Southerly aspects above 900 metres, mainly in wind sheltered locations. Older snow had not yet refrozen. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Initially unstable windslab will continue to develop on South-East to South-West aspects above 1000m.  As the day progresses lying snow will be redistributed and new windslab will develop on North-West to North-East aspects mainly above 1000m; this will become increasingly unstable during the afternoon with avalanches likely. Localised windslab also on steep banks below 1000m. Cross loading onto West and East aspects.  Fragile cornices will develop. The avalanche hazard will be Considerable.
avalancheActivity.highlights: NC for 16.3: Instabilities SE-SW asp, then during afternoon avalanches likely NW-NE asp, all abv. 1000m. Cornices! Considerable Haz.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Light snow showers will clear during the early evening.  Strong North-North-West winds will veer and become light Easterly by dawn.  During the day South-South-East winds will steadily increase strong, then gale force by mid afternoon.  The freezing level will fall to 600 metres and steadily rise to 900 metres during the day.
Observed Weather Influences: Snowfall throughout the day on fresh Northerly winds.  The freezing level at midday was around 900 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: There is a covering of new snow above 600 metres.  Localised accumulations of moderate and poorly bonded windslab have developed on South-East to South-West aspects above 1000 metres.  Fragile cornices have also developed on these aspects.  Cross loading has affected  Northerly aspects.  The greatest instability is in wind sheltered steep locations such as gully exits, crag aprons and coire rims.  The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: The recent shallow covering of snow above 650 metres, mostly lying on bare ground, will thaw at lower levels through the day. Isolated deeper deposits of snow are likely in sheltered South to South-West aspects above 800 metres, but will not be significant. The old snow will remain firm and well bonded, largely found on high North to East aspects on the more inland mountains. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: TOR for 16/3 Little change. The snowpack will generally have good stability throughout. Recent new snow will thaw. Av Hazard Low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Showers will peter out early evening to give a largely dry day, although a little summit snow is possible late afternoon on the coastal hills. Fresh Northerly winds will become light overnight, freshening again and veering South-East through the day. Colder overnight, with the freezing level rising from around 600 metres to near summit levels by day.
Observed Weather Influences: Overnight rain and snow eased to showers by mid morning to give a drier afternoon. Light to moderate North-West wind. Freezing level around 700 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: There is a covering of fresh snow above 650 metres, mostly lying on bare ground and is generally shallow throughout. The old snow is firm and well bonded, largely found on high North to East aspects on the more inland mountains such as in the Fannaich range. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Localised accumulations of moderately bonded windslab will persist on South to West aspects above 950 metres. Further accumulations will develop on North-West and North aspects above 950 metres, as snow is redistributed. Steep wind sheltered locations such as gully tops and scarp slopes will be affected, although most accumulations are expected to be shallow and avoidable. Slopes exposed to the wind will become firm. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: CM for 16.3. Windslab localised S,SW,W,NW and N aspects above 950 metres. Slow consolidation Avalanche Hazard Low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Trace snowfall overnight is expected to precede a generally dry day. Overnight winds will be strong Northerlies, veering to Easterly and decreasing to become light in strength. During the day winds will increase to become very strong South-Easterlies. The freezing level will be around 700 metres rising later, however the snow temperatures will remain sub zero due a stable airmass.
Observed Weather Influences: Overnight snow fall and light snow showers during the day, confined to above 800 metres at midday. Winds were moderate and from the East-South-East. The freezing level was around 950 metres at midday.
ObservedSnowStability: Localised accumulations of moderately bonded windslab are present, on South through West to North-West aspects above 950 metres. Steep wind sheltered locations such as gully tops and scarp slopes are particularly affected. Outwith these locations, a firm crust is evident where the moist snowpack is exposed to the wind. Elsewhere a cosmetic dusting of wet snow is present above 800 metres. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Localised areas of unstable windslab will persist mainly on South-West to North-West aspects above 1000 metres. North aspects will also be affected in the afternoon due to snow redistribution as the wind increases. Locations such as gullies, corrie rims and ridge flanks where windslab overlies the older snowpack will be most affected. The older snowpack will be well bonded and stable. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
avalancheActivity.highlights: LO for 16/3/24. Localised unstable windslab mainly on SW-W-N aspects above 1000m. Older snowpack stable. Moderate hazard.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: It will be generally dry. Fresh North-East winds will become light in the early morning, veering to the South- East and increasing to strong during the day. The freezing level will be around 700 metres overnight, rising to around summit level by the end of the afternoon.
Observed Weather Influences: There were occasional showers falling as snow above 600 metres. Moderate North-Easterly winds. The freezing level rose slowly through the day, to around 800 metres at midday.
ObservedSnowStability: Localised areas of poorly bonded windslab are present with greatest accumulations on South-West to North-West aspects above 1000 metres. Locations where this overlies the existing snowpack rather than bare ground are particularly affected. The older snowpack is well bonded and stable and fresh snow deposits at lower elevations are not significant. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.
